titleStmt.title: W. D. Hopper to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1058

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Requisitions for the Return of Fugitives from Justice, 1863-1867

body.p:
Office Garrard Circuit Court
Decr 18th 1863.
Honl Thos E. Bramlette.
Sir.
I send you herewith, a copy of an Indictment, found at the Feby term 1863 of this Court vs John Brown -- Said Brown fled from the officers and is now in Orange County Indiana.

I would suggest Agrippa Scott, of Paoli Indiana, as a suitable person to act as agent in conveying said Brown when apprehended to this jail -- he is well acquainted with Brown, and was a witness before the grand jury -- it is through th said Scott that I get the information of Browns whereabouts --

Respectfully.
W. D. Hopper clk
Garrard Circuit Court

Requisition
on
Indiana
for
John Brown
23d Dec/63
